    • response_table

Forest plot (table + graph)

Forest plot (table + graph)

g_forest(tbl, i_col_est, i_col_ci, header_forest, padx = unit(0, "lines"),
  cex = 1)

Arguments

padx

gap between two columns
cex

multiplier applied to overall fontsize
x

rtable from forest_rsp function or from forest_tte function
arm.ref

string used to label reference arm
arm.comp

string used to label comparable arm
anl.model

the regression method used for analysis. Valid options are survival and logistic
time.unit

string used to display the unit of median survival time. default is "month".

Examples


library(random.cdisc.data)

ASL <- radam("ASL")
ATE <- radam("ATE", ADSL = ASL)

ATE_f <- ATE %>% filter(PARAMCD == "OS")

ANL <- merge(ASL %>% select(USUBJID, STUDYID, SEX, RACE, ARM), ATE_f)

tbl <- t_forest_tte(
  tte = ANL$AVAL,
  is_event = ANL$CNSR == 0,
  col_by = factor(ANL$ARM),
  group_data = as.data.frame(lapply(ANL[, c("SEX", "RACE")], as.factor))
)

g <- g_forest(tbl = tbl, i_col_est = 8, i_col_ci = 9, header_forest = c("Treatement Better", "Comparison Better"))
#> Error in stringWidth(rn[which.max(nchar(rn))]): object 'rn' not found

library(grid)
grid.newpage()
grid.draw(g)
#> Error in grid.draw(g): object 'g' not found





library(random.cdisc.data)
ASL <- radam("ASL")
ARS <- radam("ARS", ADSL = ASL)

ARS_f <- ARS %>% filter(PARAMCD == "OVRSPI")

ASL_f <- right_join(ASL %>% select(USUBJID, STUDYID, SEX, RACE, ARM),
                        ARS_f %>% select(USUBJID, STUDYID))
#> Joining, by = c("USUBJID", "STUDYID")

tbl <- t_forest_rsp(
  response = ARS_f$AVAL,
  event = ARS_f$AVALC %in% c("CR","PR"),
  arm = ASL_f$ARM,
  group_data = ASL_f %>% select("SEX", "RACE")
)
#> Error in t_forest_rsp(response = ARS_f$AVAL, event = ARS_f$AVALC %in%     c("CR", "PR"), arm = ASL_f$ARM, group_data = ASL_f %>% select("SEX",     "RACE")): unused arguments (response = ARS_f$AVAL, event = ARS_f$AVALC %in% c("CR", "PR"), arm = ASL_f$ARM)

g_forest(tbl)
#> Error in stringWidth(rn[which.max(nchar(rn))]): object 'rn' not found
